p: Chronic cough, which is defined as a cough lasting for more than 8 weeks, is the most common symptom that accompanies a diverse range of respiratory diseases, non-respiratory conditions, and rarer conditions ( 1, 2). Various causes of chronic cough have been found, including upper airway cough syndrome, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD)/laryngopharyngeal reflux disease, asthma, and non-asthmatic eosinophilic bronchitis (NAEB); however, almost 7% of all chronic coughs are unexplained ( 3â€“ 5). This case report describes a patient with premature ventricular beats (PVCs) presenting with chronic cough and cough syncope.
